occasion cariage wallet tollerable among knight errant respect hee advise seeing hee might yet command one receiving order knighthood hand shortly become godchilde hee travell thence forward without night likewise began lock splendor day inkeeper mean season recounted rest lodged inne folly guest watching armes knighthood hee expected receive admired much strange kinde folly went behold far saw thou hast said shown one poore glaunce since love soonest tongue bewrayd yet cause ever held thee wise mee assures thou bearest mee good hee unfortunate see affection taken ill yet olalia ti true observance gather woe thy mind framd brasse art undue flint thy bosom though seem snow yet amidst thy rigor winterface shift thou usest delay somtimes hope peeping doth promise grace woe mee feare ti betray mee sweetest ballance thy minde poise weight faith never yet diminisht though disfavour finde increase though thou favordst love courteous men say thy humanity must collect hope howsever thou dost use delay shall reap last good doe expect many service bee esteeme powr render hard heart benign thing thee make mee deems match gaind thou shalt mine time thou hast tane heed thou mightst view clad honour thee monday weed worn sondaies got mee credit love bravry still consort shoote ever one end made mee thee resort still bee neat fine contend omit daunces done musicks thy window given thou didst cockcrow listen alone seemdst hearing voice heavn doe eke praise recount thy beauty oft said though true likewise wont make thee enuious spight upbraid teresa shee berrocal thy worth discourse somtime shape good god quoth shee seem angel thrall yet idoll adore ape shee bugle thanks may give chain false haires shift shee doth use mend beauty thousand pain guile might love self abuse wroth word gave streight lie cousin offend mee fight hee challengd presently well thou knowst debate end meane thee purchase clap end doe thy favour sue thereby thine honour either intrap thee perswade take course undue church hath band doe surely hold silk string strength come neer thrust thy neck yoake bee bold see follow thee fear thou wilt solemnly vow holliest saint enwrapt precious shrine never leave hils dwell ift bee become capucine goatheard ended ditty although donquixote intreated sing somwhat else yet would sancho panca consent time better disposed sleep heare musick therefore said master better provide self place wherein sleep night heare music labour good men indure day long doth permit likewise spend night singing understand thee well enough sancho answered donquixote thinke lesse thy manifold visitation winebottle would rather desire bee recompenced sleepe music wine liked u well quoth sancho doe denie replyed donquixote goe thou lay thee downe thou pleasest becomes much men profession watch sleepe yet notwithstanding bee amisse lay somwhat againe mine eare grief mee much one goatheards beholding hurt bad bee good cheere hee would apply remedy cure easily taking rosemary leaf many grew thereabouts hee hewed mixed little salt among applyed medecine eare hee bound well cloth assuring needed use medecine proved effect chap iv one goatheards recounted donquixote time arived another youth one brought provision village said companion doe know passeth village wee know beeing absent say another wit quoth youth famous sheepheard student chrisostome died morning murmur hee died love divellish lasse mareela william rich daughter shee go plaines hill among u habit sheepheardesse dost thou mean marcela quoth one even say answered jest hee hath commanded return day village doe quoth goatheards draw lot shall tarry keep heards thou saist well peter quoth one although labour may excused mean stay behinde must attribute virtue little curiosity rather rozinante tooke certain desire sollace lady mare therefore soone hee smelt abandoning naturall pace custome without taking leave master hee begen little swift trot went communicate necessity seemed desire feede sollace entertained heeles teeth sort broke gyrts left naked hayre overthrown saddle surely grieved carrier perceiving violence offered mare repaired presently succour club truncheon belabour farely laid along season donquixote sancho beheld bombasting rozinante approached breathlesse donquixote said sancho much perceive friend sancho men knight base rascally people vile quality say thou mayst help mee take due revenge outrage done face rozinante divel quoth sancho revenge wee take bee twenty wee two peradventure one half worth hundred replied donquixote without making longer discourse hee set hand sword flew upon yanguesians sancho panca moved lord example like first blow donquixote piercing buffe coate one wore wounded grievously shoulder yanguesians seeing rudely handled two men many ran stake truncheon carriage hemming adversary midst laid admirable speede vehemency true second peale struck sancho downe ground like hapned donquixote dexterity courage nothing availeable traunce fate ordayning hee fell courser feete yet gotten wee may ponder fury wherewithall truncheon batter placed wrathfull rusticall fist carrier perceiving evill committed trussing loading possible speede followed way leaving adventurer bad fashion worse talent first came sancho panca seeing lord neere unto said weake pittifull voice sir donquixote sir donquixote wouldst thou brother sancho replied knight like efeminate dolefull tune would quoth sancho worship draught two liquor feoblas hand perhaps good cure broken bone well help wound would wee want unhappy replied donquixote sweare unto sancho panca faith knight errant two day passe fortune dispose otherwise power shall hardly escape hand pray quoth sancho within many dayes think shall wee bee able stirre feete say selfe quoth crushed knight cannot set certain term dayes recovery fault drawn sword men knight well therefore beleeve god battels hath permitted punishment bee given unto mee paine transgressing lawes knighthood wherefore brother sancho requisite thou beest advertized shall say unto thee importeth good much thou beholdest like rascally rabble doe u wrong doe wait till set hand sword doe sort draw thou thine chastise thy pleasure knight shall come assistance succour shall know defend thee offend force thou hast perceived thousand signes experience far valour mine invincible arme extendeth self arrogant remained poore knight victory hee gotten hardy biscaine advice lord seemed good sancho panca hee would omit answere unto saying sir peaceable quiet sober man dissemble injury wife child maintaine bring wherefore let likewise bee advice seeing cannot commandement set hand sword wise bee clowne knight time forward doe pardon god wrong done shall doe unto mee whether bee shall bee done high low person rich poore gentleman churle without excepting state condition heard lord hee said could wish breath enough might answere thee little case griefe feele rib asswaged ever little might panca make thee understand errour wherein thou art come poor fool gale fortune hitherto contrarie doe turn favour swelling sayles desire sort may securely without hindrance arrive island promised unto thee would become thee conquering make thee lord thereof seeing thou wouldest disable thy self respect thou knight desirest one wouldest valour revenge thine injury defend thy lordship thou must understand kingdomes province newly conquered mind inhabitant never throughly appeased weded affection new lord feared worke noveltie alter thing turn men say afresh trie fortune therefore requisite new possessor understanding govern valour offend defend adventure whatsoever last hath befaln u quoth sancho would ad understanding valour speak vow unto faith poor man fitter plaisters discourse pray try whether arise help rozinante although deserves principall cause trouble would never believed like rozinante ever held chaste peaceable person self fine say well one must long time come knowledge body there nothing life secure durst affirm mightie blow gave unfortunate knight errant would succeede poste pursuit furious tempest stave hath discharged shoulder thine sancho replyed donquixote perhaps accustomed bear like shower mine nursed sinabafa cottens holland evident must feel grief disgrace imagine doe say imagine know certainly incommodities annexd exercise armes would dye wrath displeasure squire answered sir seeing disgrace cosecha essence knighthood pray whether succeed often whether certain time limited wherein befall think within two adventure shall wholly remain dis abled third god mercy doe succour u know friend sancho replyed donquixote life knight errant subject thousand danger misfortune also well next degree power make king emperours experience hath shewn sundry knight whose history intire notice could recount unto thee pain suffer permit mounted high degree said valour arm men found diver misery calamity valorus amadis gaule saw power mortall enemie arcalaus inchanter opinion run infallible gave unto prisoner two hundred stripe horse bridle tyed pillar basecourt moreover secret authour little credit sayes cavalier del febo taken gin like unto snatch slipt foot certain castle fall found deep dungeon earth bound hand foot gave unto glister snowwater sand brought almost end life succoured great distresse wise man great friend gone ill poor knight may well passe among many worthy person danger disgrace suffered greater doe indure sancho would thee understand wound given one instrument one hand chance doe disgrace man written law single combat expresse term shoemaker strike another last hath hand although certainly wood yet cannot said stricken bastanado say end thou mayst think although remain bruised last conflict therefore disgraced armes men bore wherewithall laboured u none packstaves far remember never one tuck sword dagger gave mee leisure answered sancho looke neerely scarce laid hand trunchant blist shoulder pine sort wholly deprived mee sight force foot together striking mee place yet lie straught pain disgrace received cudgeling doth much pinch mee grief blowes shall remaine deeply imprinted memorie doe back thou shalt understand brother panca replied donquixote remembrance time end grief death consume greater misfortune quoth sancho bee expecteth time death end consume disgrace kinde might bee cured payre two playsters would bee evill begin perceive salve hospitall suffice bring good term leave sancho gather strength weakenesse said donquixote likewise doe let u see doth rozinante mee think lest part mishap hath faln lot ought marvell quoth sancho seeing hee likewise knight errant whereat wonder mine asse remaines without payment wee come away without rib fortune leaf alwaies one dore open disaster quoth donquixote whereby remedie say little beast may supply rozinanties want carrying mee hence unto castle wherein may bee cured wound doe hold kinde riding dishonourable remember read good old silenus tutor merry god laughter hee entred citie hundred gate rode fairly mounted goodly asse like quoth sancho hee rode say upon asse great difference betwixt riding cast athwart upon one like sack rubbish donquixote answered wound received battell doe rather give honour deprive men wherefore friend panca doe reply unto mee said arise well thou canst lay mee thou pleasest upon thy beast let u depart hence night overtake u desarts yet heard say quoth panca ordinary custome knight errant sleepe downes desarts yeere doe hold good hap said donquixote none shift love true hath knight hath desarts rarely trodden goat wolf savage beast frequented mountain sancho answered hee would descend would give account thereof sheepheard came arriving place donquixote hee said dare wager look hyred mule lie dead bottome well good faith hath lien place six moneths say pray met way master thereof wee encountred body cushion little malet found far hence likewise finde replyed goatheard would never take approach fearfull misdemeanor hereafter demanded stealth divell crafty something ariseth even man foot whereat stumble fall without knowing say quoth sancho likewise found would approach cast stone left remains would dog bell tell good fellow quoth donquixote dost thou know owner thing say answered goatheard six moneths past little lesse arrived certain sheep fold three league young gentleman comely personage presence mounted mule lie dead cushion malet say met touched hee demanded u hidden inaccessable part mountain told wherein true enter half league farther perhaps would finde way readily doe greatly marvell could finde way hither self neither high way path may addresse place say young man soon heard answer turned bridle travelled towards place shewed leaving u great liking comelinesse marvelled demand speed wherewith departed made towards mountain time see good many dayes untill chance one sheepheards came provision victual hee drew nee without speaking word spurned bea welfavourdly went asse carried victual taking away bread cheese hee fled mountain wonderfull speed heard u goatheards went search spent therein almost two dayes solitary place mountain end found lurking hollow part tall great corketree soon perceived u came forth meet u great staidnesse apparrell torn visage disfigured toasted sunne manner could scarce know attire although rent notice give u understand man sought saluted u courteously brief good reason said ought marvell seeing goe manner behoved doe might accomplish certain penance injoyned many sinns hee committed prayed tell u could never perswade wee requested likewise whensoever hee need meat without hee could live hee tell u might finde wee would bring great love dilligence also like motion would least wise come ask take violently done sheepheards thanked u much offer intreated pardon assults passed promised ask thence forward god sake without giving annoyance one touching dwelling place abode said none night overtook ended discourse feelling lament might well accounted stone heard therein kept company considering state wherein wee seen first wherein said comely gracious young man shewed courteous orderly speech well borne courtlike person though wee clown hear gentility could make self known even rudenesse self best discourse stopt grew silent fixing eye ground good wherein likewise stood still suspended expecting distraction would end little compassion behold easily perceived accident madness surprized staring beholding earth fixedly without moving eyelid time shutting byting lip bending brow speedily made u certain thereof rising ground wheron thrown little great furie set upon sate next unto courage rage wee taken away would slain blow bite hee saying treacherous fernando thou shalt pay injurie thou didst hand shall rent heart doe harbour heaped evills together principally fraud deceit hee added word addrest dispraise fernando attach treason untruth wee tooke last without difficulty fellow hee without saying word departed u embushing himselfe presently among bush bramble leaving u wholly disabled follow rough unhaunted place wee gathered madnesse come time one called fernando done ill worke weight termes shew hath brought hath beene yet confirmed often many time hee came field sometimes demand meat sheepheards time take perforce hee taken fit madnesse although sheepheards doe offer meat willingly yet hee receive unlesse hee take buffet hee right sense hee asks god sake courtesie humanitie render many thanks without teares truth sir say unto quoth goatheard foure others donquixote dulcinea toboso soveraign ladie wounded poynt absence hurt dart thy heart sweetest dulcinea toboso doth send thee health hee wanteth thy beauty disdain thy valour turn benefit thy disdain convert harm maugre patience shall bee ill able sustein care besides violent also durable good squire sancho give thee certain relation beautifull ingrate deerest beloved enemy state wherein remain thou art grown mad self mad replyed sancho cholerick setting aside say eat untill return doe mean doe cardenio take highwayes side perforce sheepheards care thou replyed donquixote although yet would eat thing hearbs fruit field tree doe yield perfection mine affair consists fasting exercise castigation sancho replyed doe know fear shall finde way leave difficult obscure take well mark endevour way thou goest untill thou beest plain may serve thee bound mark thou mayest finde thou returnest imitation clue thesis labyrinth doe quoth sancho cutting downe certaine boughes hee demanded lord blessing departed without teares side mounting upon rozinante donquixote commended seriously care hee tender hee would owne person hee made towards plaines strewing way branch master advised departed although lord importuned behold two three folly ere hee went away scarce hee gone hundred pace hee returned said say sir said well end might sweare safe conscience seene play mad trick necessary least see doe one although abode one great enough tell thee quoth donquixote stay sancho doe space creede taking haste ho e hee remained halfe maked instantly give two three jerk ayre two tumble ove ground xii wherein prosecuted prankes played donquixote amorous humor mountaines sierra morena turning recount knight illfavoured face hee alone history sayes donquixote ended friskes leapes naked gyrdle befall adventure animated self best could entred house one knew well entry passage thereof specially reason trouble businesse hand went unperceived thus without beeing seen oportunity place self j well bee robbed exclaim theese might revenged self much heart doe complain fine since coward fool matter though dye ashamed sorry frantic curate stood expecting luscindaes answer good shee gave end much whether seen bearing withall resolution perceived play rash part world understand indignation brest revenge would take false fernando mutable dismayed traytresse destiny hath reserved greater evills possibly bee greater mine owne ordained instant wit abound whereof ever since great want therefore without take revenge greatest enemy might taken facilitie reason suspected little determined house came left mule caused bee sadled without biding mine host adieu mounted rode city without daring like another lot turne back behold seeing selfe alone field darknesse night cover mee silence untill arived last certaine medowes field lye know part mountaines finding certaine heards demanded way lay craggy inaccessible place rock directed mee hither presently travelled towards purpose end knowing might succour mee remained manner know long prostrate ground rose againe without hunger found neere unto mee certaine goatheards doubtlesly fed mee hunger told manner found spake many foolish good sir replied dolorous damzel shee saying sancho panca rounded lord eare saying softly sir may well grant request asketh matter nothing kill monstrous gyant demand mightie princesse micomicona self shortly restored kingdome enthronized chair ancient great estate despite maugre traytors shall dare gainsay therefore hand work say danger alwayes follows delay distressed damzell strove much adoe kisse hand donquixote accomplished knight courtesie would never condescend thereunto making arise hee imbraced great kindnesse respect commanded sancho saddle rozinante help arme sancho took armes forthwith hung tree like trophy searching gyrts armed lord moment seeing armed said let u god name depart hence assist great lady barber kneeled could much adoe dissemble laughter keep beard threatned still fall whose fall perhaps remained without bringing good purpose passe seeing boon granted noted dilligence wherewithall donquixote made ready depart accomplish hee arose took ladie hand lord way next degree bee emperour made infallible account hee would marry princesse least bee king micomicon yet grieved think kingdome country black moor therefore nation bee given vassal black difficultie imagination coyned presently good remedie hee discoursed manner care though subject black moor done load ship bring spain may sell receive price ready mony money may buy title office true quoth andrew avail thou shalt see whether avail presently quoth donquixote saying got hastily comanded sancho bridle rozinante feeding whilest eate dorotea demanded meant doe answered would goe finde villain punish using bad proceeding cause andrew paid last denier despite many peasant lived world answered intreating remember hee could deale adventure according promise untill atchieved reasonable good bed wide room lay went presently bed reason arived much tyred void wit scarce gotten chamber hostesse leaping suddainly barber taking beard said self blessed thou shalt use taile beard listen pleasure hinders thousand hoary haires dare say least selfe heard tell furious terrible blowes knight errant give inflames mee desire become one selfe could finde heart bee hearing day night recall home house subject letter chap vii wherein prosecuted historie curiousimpertinent even commonly said armie seems well without generall castle without constable doe affirm much indecent see young married woman without husband hee justly deteined away necessarie affair finde self illdisposed absence impatient impotent indure longer doe speedily return shall bee constrained return back unto father although leave house without keeping guard appointed bee hee may deserve title look believe pleasure concern therefore seeing wit enough say ought say reason anselmo received letter understood lothario begun enterprize camila answered according hoped marvellous glad news hee answered wife word mouth shee remove wise house hee would return speed camila greatly admired answer struck greater perplexitie shee first afraid stay home also goe father staying shee indangers honesty going shee transgresse husband command last shee resolved doe worst remain home shun lothario presence lest shee give servant occa ion suspi ion shee grieved written shee husb nd fearfull lest hee think lothario noted token lightn sse might moved lose respect otherwise due unto er confident innocencie shee cast hope god good thou hts wherewithall shee thought resist lothario word holding silent ithout making answer without giving account matter husband lest thereby shee might plunge new difficulty contention ich friend therefore bethink shee might excuse lothario anselmo hee demand occasion moved write unto himthat letter honest profitable discreet resolution shee gave eare th second hee resolved hee bethought great goe friend village wherein hee hee afforded leisure contrive disaster shutting house hee mounted horseback rode away languishing dolefull wise scarce hee ridden half way hee fiercely assaulted thought hee constrained alight tying horse tree hee leaned trunck thereof breathed thousand pittifull dolorous sigh hee abode untill almost night hour espyed man come citie hee came friend house heard nothing yet disgrace perceiving arive wan pined dried hee presently conjectured grievous evill afflicted anselmo requested presently hee might bee caried chamber provided woman doe greatly estrange sight christian behaviour conversation thing squeamish wee said already shee greatly feare approach place father talked rather father perceiving shee came slowly call commanded draw neer thing impossible mee recount g beauty gallant disposition bravery rich attyre wherein beloved zoraida shewed self mine eye say hanged pearles eares superlative faire neck haire thousand crownes wrests hand equall esteeme pearles many orient chief bravery ornament moorish lady consists adorning pearles pearleseed reason whereof pearles pearleseed bee found among moore among nation world zoraidaes father fame many best argiers also two hundred thousand ducat spanish gold shee lady mine ornament shee could seeme faire reliques remained unto among many labour may bee easily guessed shee would beene time prosperitie u doe know beauty woman hath limited dayes season requireth certaine accident either diminish increase thing naturall passion minde eyther rayse abase commonly wholly destroy bee briefe say shee arived place wee discoursed time richly attyred beautifull beyond measure least deemed fairest ever heheld untill herewithall remembring obligation wherein shee tyed mee thought deitie presented selfe view come heaven earth recreation reliefe soone shee arived father told owne language friend arnaute mami captive came gather sallad shee taking speech demanded medley tongue spoken whether gentleman reason redeemed selfe made answere already ransomed ransome might bee conjectured much master valued seeing hee libertie thousand five hundred coltamis shee answered good sooth thou wert father would cause give thee twice much christian great lyers doe make every one self poore men defraud moore due ransome may well bee maddam quoth part used truth affayre master doe use truth many person shall ever occasion treat world doest thou goe away quoth zoraida morrow beleeve quoth french vessell set forth morrow mean depart better replyed zoraida expect untill vessells come spain goe away france friend quoth although true news runne come vessell spain would attend yet certain shall depart morrow desire see self home countrey person love great permit expect commoditie foreslowes self bee never good thou art doubtlesly married thy countrie said zoraida therefore desir st goe see thy wife married quoth passed word marry soon safely arrived shee beautifull thou hast past quoth zoraida beautifull said indeer tell truth shee like unto selfe hereat father laughed heartily said good earnest christian shee must bee fair may compare daughter beautifull kingdom thou wilt beleeve look well thou shalt see tell thee truth hee perfect tongue serve interpreter speech although shee could speak illegitimate language use yet shee manifest minde signes word whilst thus reasoned many matter came running towards u certaine moor told master four turkes leaped garden wall gathering fruit although yet ripe old man daughter zoraida started hereat universall naturall defect moor fear turk specially souldiers nation commonly insolent command moor subject doe use worse slave therefore zoraidas father said unto daughter retire thy self house keep thy self whilest goe speake doggs thou christian goe seek thine hearbs depart good hour pray ala conduct thee safely thy countrey inclined self hee departed search turk leaving mee alone zoraida began make adoe shee went whither father commanded scarce hee covered among tree garden returned eye full teares said amexi christiano amexi goest thou away christian goest thou away answered yes ladie doe never depart without thee expect mee next friday bee affrighted thou shalt see u wee goe christian countrey without doubt said sort shee understood word well casting arme neck shee began travell languishing step towards house fortune would might ill heaven rectified wee walked together manner forme father return hee caused turk depart espyed u wee saw also well hee perceived u wherefore zoraida discreet would take away arme neck rather drew neerer unto laid head brest bowed knee little evident token shee swouned likewise made though sustain force father came running towards u seeing well furnished victual although row refused offer saying time repose set row dinner would yet sort let goe oares done said winde rise much made u abandoning oares set sail direct boat towards oran clara self would hear stopt eares finger whereat dorotea also marvell attentive musick shee heard lacquie prosecute song manner sweet constant hope breakst impossibility bryers firmly runst scope thou thy self doest forge thy desire dismaid see every step thy self nigh death bee sluggard doe deserve glorie triumph victorie good hap doth never serve resist fortune manfully weakly fall ground soft sloth sences confound love glory hold high rate reason precious stone gold may bee compared love gust ti thing clear nothing worth esteem cost dear amorous persistance obtaineth ofttimes thing impossible though resistance finde soul desire stern hope time shall bee given earth may reach glorious heavn voyce ended donna claras sigh began inflamed doroteas desire know cause sweet song sad plaint therefore shee eftsoons required tell shee said clara timorous lest luscinda overhear imbracing dorotea neerly laid mouth closely doroteas eare shee might speak securely without understood said hee sings dear ladie gentleman sonne kingdome aragon whose father lord two town dwelled right father house court although window house winter covered searcloth summer lattice know happened gentleman went school espied whether church elsewhere certain finally hee fell love acquite affection window opposite mine many token abundance teares forceably believed also affected without knowing much hee loved among signes hee would make one joyn one hand giving thereby understand hee would marry although would glad might bee yet one alone without mother knew might communicate affair therefore let rest without affording favour unlesse father gone abroad lifting lattice searcloth little permitting behold favour hee would shew signes joy man would deem bee reft wit time father departure ariving hee hearing mee could never tell hee fell sick far could understand griefe therefore could never see day departure bid farewell least mine eye wee travelled two dayes wee entred inne village dayes journey hence saw lodging dore appareled properly like lackey borne mee portraiture soule beene impossible know knew wondred glad withall hee beheld mee unwitting father whose presence hee still hide himselfe hee cross way mee travell wee arive inne know hee doe consider paine hee take coming thus foote sake great toyle die sorrow hee put feete also put mine eye know intention hee come hee could possibly thus escape father love beyond measure hee hath none heir young gentleman also deserves perceive see dare affirme besides hee say hee composes ex tempore without study heard hee fine student great poet every time see doe heare sing start tremble like aspenleafe feare father know thereby come notice mutuall affection never spoken one word life yet doe neverthelesse love much without shall bee able live deer ladie able say unto musician whose voice hath pleased well alone might conjecture horseboy said rather lord soules townes affirmed speake lady clara quoth dorotea season kissing thousand time speake say patience untill bee day light hope god direct affaire shall fortunate successe honest beginning deserves ala madam quoth donna clara end may expected seeing father noble rich hee would scarce deeme mee worthy bee sonnes servant much lesse spouse mee marry selfe unknown father would doe world desire thing young gentleman would returne home againe leave mee alone perhaps seeing great distance way wee travell paine much presseth mee bee somwhat allayed although dare say remedy imagined would availe mee little know whence vengeance way affection beare got mee seeing hee young wee bee beleeve wee much age yet full sixteene shall bee father sayes untill michaelmas next dorotea could contain laughter hearing childishly donna clara spoke shee said lady let u repose againe sleepe little part night remaines god sends day light wee prosper hand shall faile mee held peace inn drowned profound silence innekeepers daughter maritorners asleepe knowing well donquixotes peccant humor hee armed horseback without inne keeping guard consorted together agreed bee way merry least passe time hearing speake ravingly therefore bee understood inne window looked field one hole barne wont cast straw hole came two demydemzells saw donquixote mounted leaning javelin breathing forth ever anon dolefull deepe sighes seemed soule plucked away every one noted besides hee said soft amorous voice lady dulcinea toboso sunne beauty end quintessence discretion treasurie sweete countenance carriage storehouse honestie finally idea profitable modest delightfull world might thy ladyship bee present hast thou perhaps thy minde upon thy captive knight wittingly exposeth himselfe many danger thy sake give unto mee tidings thou luminary three face peradventure dost envie enough behold eyther walking gallerie sumptuous palace leaning baywindow thinking saving honour greatnesse shee shall mittigate asswage torture mine oppressed heart indures love glory shee shall give pain doe kisse face thou doest become jealous thee ever thou wast swift ingrate made thee runn sweat much thorow plain thessalia brink peneo forgotten thou rannest jealous inamoured point arrived donquixote innekeepers daughter began call softly unto say sir knight approach little hitherward please voyce donquixote turned head saw light moon shined cleerly hee called hole hee accounted bee fair window full iron bar costly gilded gold well befitting rich castle hee imagined inne bee presently moment hee forged fancie hee done beautifull damzell daughter ladie castle overcome love returne sollicite thought hee would shew discourteous ungratefull hee turned rozinante came hole beheld two wench hee said take pittie beautifull ladie placed amorous thought place whence possible correspondence answerable desert high worth beauty whereof sort condemn miserable knight errant love hath wholly disabled surrender first sight hee made absolute mistrisse soul pardon therefore good ladie retire self chamber make insinuation desire unthankfull discourteous would bee love bear finde thing wherewithall may serve pleasure bee love self demand boldly doe sweare unto mine absence yet sweetest enemie bestow upon incontinently yea though bee lock medusa haires snake sunnebeams inclosed viall glasse lady need none thing sir knight answered maritornes doth shee want discreet matron quoth donquixote one faire hand said maritornes therewithall shee may disburden selfe part violent desire compelled come window great danger honour lord father knew comming least slice would take bee least eare would faine see quoth donquixote sure beware doe list make disastrous end ever father made world laied violent hand delicate limb amorous daughter maritornes verily perswaded self better reach barred windowes whereat hee imagined wounded damzell remained stretching hand say unto hold lady hand may better say executioner earthly miscreant hold say hand woman ever touched even shee self hath intyre possession whole body doe give end kisse may behold contexture sinnews knitting muscle spaciositie hredth vein whereby may collect great ought force arme bee whereunto hand knit wee shall see presently quoth maritornes making running knot halter shee cast wrist hand descending hole shee tyed end halter fast lock barn door donquixote feeling roughnesse halter wrist said rather seems grate hand cherish yet pray handle roughly seeing fault evill doth unto comely revenge disburden whole bulk indignation small part remember love well doe take cruell revenge body gave eare word donquixote soon maritornes tyed shee almost burst laughter ran away left tyed manner impossible loose hee stood wee recounted rozinante saddle arme thrust hole fastened wrist lock great doubt fear rozinante budged never little side hee fall hang arme therefore hee durst use least motion world although hee might well expected rozinantes patience milde spirit hee suffered hee would stand still whole age without stirring fine donquixote seeing tyed lady departed began straight imagine done way inchantment last time castle inchanted moor carrier fairly belaboured execrate want discretion discourse seeing escaped castle evill dight first time would adventure enter second generally observed knight errant tried adventure could finish token reserved therefore would never prove yet hee drew forward arme see hee might deliver hee well bound indeavours proved vain true hee drew warily lest rozinante stir although hee would fain set setled saddle yet could hee doe stand leave arme behinde many wish amadis sword inchantment whatsoever could prevail succeeded malediction fate exaggerating want world presence hee abode inchanted hee infallibly believed hee place hee anew remembred beloved lady dulcinea toboso hee call oft enough good squire sancho panca intombed bowel sleep stretched along pannell asse dream instant little mother bore hee invoked wise men lirgandeo aquife help finally morning also overtake full despair confusion hee roared like bull hee hope daylight cure could bee found care hee deemed would bee everlasting hee fully accounted inchanted induced think hee saw rozinante move little much therefore hee supposed hee horse abide state without eating drinking sleeping untill either malignant influence star passed greater inchanter disinchanted hee deceived himselfe much beleefe scarce day begin peepe arived foure horseman inn doore well appointed snaphances hanging pommell saddle called inn door yet stood shut knocked hard perceived donquixote place hee stood centinell hee said loud arrogant voice knight squire whatsoever else ye bee knock gate castle seeing evident houres eyther within doe repose else wont open fortress untill phoebus hath spread beames earth therefore stand back expect till cleere day wee see whether bee open gate unto divell castle fortresse quoth one binde u use circumstance thou beest inkeeper command doore bee opened wee traveller tarry longer baite horse away wee ride poste haste doth seeme gentleman quoth donquixote looke like inkeeper know thou lookest like answered well know thou speakest madly calling inne castle castle replyed donquixote yea vnd one best province hath people within scepter hand crowne head better said quite contrary replyed traveller scepter head crowne hand perhaps may well bee company player within doe usually hold scepter weare crownes whereof thou talkest paultry inne heare little noyse cannot beleeve one bee lodged worthy weare crowne beare stepter thou knowest little world replyed donquixote seeing thou dost much ignore chance wont befall chivalry fellowes entertained prolixe dialogue donquixote waxed weary heare speake idlely long together therefore turned againe knock great fury dore sort waked innekeeper also guest arose demand pleasure meane hapned one horse whereon rode drew neere smell rozinante melancholy sadly eares cast downe sustain without moving outstretched lord hee beeing indeede flesh blood although hee resembled block wood could choose feele turne smel againe thus come cherish entertaine scarce hee stirred thought thence donquixotes feete joyned slipt asunder tumbling saddle doubtlesly faln ground hee remained hanging arme thing caused indure much pain hee verily believed either wrist cutting arme tearing body hee hung neer ground hee touched top toe turned prejudice felt little hee wanted setting foot wholly earth hee laboured drew might reach much like unto get strappado condition touch touch cause increase tor ure earnestnesse unyoked ox permitting take benefit pasture green pleasant valley whose verdure invited enjoy inchanted like donquixote rather heedfull discreeet person man intreated curate licence lord come little whither body ever set eye bee surety hee shall flie away quoth sancho also quoth canon hee promise hee knight hee depart u without consent give word quoth donquixote heard said rather inchanted body free dispose list hee inchanted may make unable stir one place three dayes make escape hee compell return flying therefore since might securely set libertie especially seeing would redound much benefit free get hee protested hee could forbear offend nose canon took hand although bound faith word hee would depart gave liberty whereat hee infinitely rejoyced especially seeing cage first thing hee must return hard exercise armes therefore hee could carry wardrobe sompters sancho took meaning sell first occasion offered wisht day come donquixote armed sancho clad upon dapple hee would leave though given horse thrust amongst troop woodman duchesse bravely attyred donquixote pure courtesie manner took rein palfrey though duke would consent last came wood two high mountain taking stand lane path hunter divided severall stand chase began great noyse hooting hollowing one could scarce heare another well cry dog sound horne duchesse alighted sharpe javelin hand shee tooke stand shee knew wilde boares used passe duke also alighted donquixote stood sancho stayed behinde stirred dapple durst leave lest ill chance befall scarce lighted set order servant saw came huge boar baited dog followed hunter gnashing teeth tuskes foaming mouth donquixote seeing buckling shield laying hand sword went forward encounter like duke javelin duchesse would beene formost duke stopped sancho wen saw valiant beast left dapple began scud fast hee could striving get high oake possible even middest fastned bough striving get top unluckie unfortunate bough broke tumbling ground hung ayre fastned snag oake unable come ground seeing himselfe perplexitie greene coat torne thinking wildebeast come thither might lay hold began cry call help outragiously heard saw thought verily wildebeast sagittarius yet left thinking governours office bee dangerous gotten quoth ricote gotten said hee experience fit governe ought herd cattell kind government wealth gotteo labour toyle losse sleep sustenance island governours fare ill especially physitians looke health understand thee sancho quoth ricote thinkes thou talkest without sense would give thee island govern want world able men thou bee governours peace sancho returne thy wit see thou wilt goe mee said help mee take treasure hidden may well bee called treasure give thee sufficient maintaine thee told thee ricote quoth sancho let suffice discover thee goe thy way god name leave mee mine know well gotten lost ill gotten owner bee earnest thee said hee tell mee wast thou town wife daughter brother law departed marry quoth sancho tell daughter shewed beautifull towne went see every one said shee fairest creature world shee went weeping embraced friend acquaintance many came see intreated recommend god feelingly shee made mee weep belweather yfaith many good minde concealed take away upon way feare resisting king commandement made abstaine hee shewed himselfe enamoured pedro gregorio youth rich heyre know well hee say loved much since shee went never seene towne wee thought hee followed steale away hitherto nothing knowne alwayes suspected quoth ricote gentleman loved daughter confident ricotas worth never troubled mee know hee loved well sure sancho thou hast heard say morisco woman seldome never love married old christian daughter beleeve rather tended soules health bee enamoured cared little rich heires solliciting god grant quoth sancho would bee ill ricote let mee goe hence meane night see master donquixote god bee thee brother sancho companion sti ring time way staight tooke leave sancho gate upon dapple ricote leant pilgrim staff departed chap lv matter befell sancho way others best world sanchos long stay ricote cause hee reached day duke castle though hee came within half league night took somewhat dark close summer time troubled much therefore hee went way purposing rest till morning ill luck would seeking place might best accommodate hee dapple fell dark deep pit amongst certain ruinous building falling hee recommended withall heart god thinking hee stop till hee came hell fell otherwise within little three fathom length dapple felt ground hee sate still upon without hurt dammage received hee felt body held breath see hee sound pierced seeing well whole catholike health hee thought hee could never praise god sufficiently favour done hee thought verily hee beaten thousand piece hee went likewise groping hand wall pit see possible get without help hee found smooth without place lay hold grieved much especially heard dapple cry tenderly dolefully marvell allow proverbe sayes let martha dye dye empty least death meane rather doe shoomaker doth streacheth leather teeth till hee make reach hee list ile draw life eating till come end heaven hath allotted know sir greater madnesse world despaire doe beleeve mee eaten rest selfe little upon downebeds green grasse shall see wake shall finde selfe somewhat lightned donquixote tooke councell taking reason bee rather philosophicall senselesse said thou sancho wouldest doe shall tell thee mee lightsomnesse would bee certaine sorrowes great whilst obeying thy counsell sleepe thou goe way little rozinantes reines turning thy flesh ayre give thy selfe three foure hundred lash upon account three thousand many thou art give disenchanting dulcinea small pitty poor lady bee enchanted thy carelesnesse least thinkes shee shall see mee sieve lash till death life meane live desire fulfill promise donquixote giving thankes eate somthing sancho great deale leaving two continuall friend companion abbot liveth singing cannot think heaven endowed virtue knowledge end communicate impart unto others nothing good friend sancho answered donquixote thou art right altisidora hath done ill shee hath given thee shirt shee promised thee although virtue propertie thou hast given thee gratis learning studying thou hast penny charge neverthelesse trouble vexation thou hast received indured thine person farr study thou couldest undergone imployed mee tell thee thou wouldest full pay whiplash thou shouldest give thy self disenchanting dulcinea thou hast already fully received yet know whether wage hire answer cure recovery would bee hindrance remedy mee seems notwithstanding one shall lose nothing tryall consider sancho thou wilt forthwith whip thy self thine hand pay thy self downright since thou hast money mine thy keeping sancho presently opened eye eares foot wide kinde offer took resolution cheerfull heart whip lash therefore said unto master time noble sir wholly dispose self give satisfaction since shall reap bene love child wife induceth regard unto harm ill may thereby come unto tell give every stripe lash bound pay thee replyed donquixote equivalent greatnesse qualitie remedy treasure venice rich mine peru would suffice recompence thee look well thy self thou hast mine value every lash thou wilt whip lash quoth sancho number three thousand three hundred odd already given self five remain behinde let five serve deduct odd number remaining let bee reduced three thousand three hundred meaning every lash piece three blank lesse world command contrary amount three thousand three hundred piece three blank three thousand make thousand five hundred half ryalls make seven hundred fifty whole ryalls three hundred make one hundred fifty half ryalls amount unto summe threescore fifteen ryalls added unto seven hundred fifty whole summe amounteth unto eight hundred five twenty ryalls reckon summe deduct keeping mean shall enter house rich well satisfied albeit well even happeneth unto lover think shall never come obtain accomplishment desire last entred grove delight tree somewhat remote highway taken saddle packsaddle rozinante dapple sate upon green grasse supped victual sancho wallet good squire made dapple halter headstall good big whip scourage hee went twenty pace master thrust among bush hedge donquixote seeing martch thus naked good courage began thus discourse unto take heed good friend thou hack thy self piece stripe lash stay one anothers leisure thou must make haste thy career thy winde breath fail thy couse meaning thou must lash thy self hard fast thy life faint thou come thy desired number end thou lose thy self want paire writingtables lesse stand aloof upon prayerbeads number lash thou shalt give thy self heaven favour thee thy good meaning well deserveth good paymaster answered sancho never grudge give wage think curry belabour self without endangering life lash shall bee sensible unto therein must substance miracle consist immediately sancho stripped bare gyndle upward taking whip hand began ribbaste lash roundly donquixote number stroke sancho given seven eight stripe hee thought hee killed pawsing hee said master hee much deceived would therefore appeale much every whiplash lieu peece three blank deserve half ryall make end friend sancho quoth donquixote bee dismaid redouble thy pay life quoth sancho blow shall shore upon thick haile mountebank cheating companion stead lashing shoulder hee whipped tree sighingly groaned every stroake would thought soul flown body donquixote full compassion fearing hee would kill folly sancho desire bee accomqlished began thus say unto friend conjure thee let businesse end remedy seems hard sharpe shall bee amisse give time unto time rome never built one day told right thou hast already given thy self thousand lash sufficeth let use homely pharse asse endure charge surcharge good sir answered sancho shall never bee said mony well paid armes broken pray goe little aside permit give self one thousand stripe shall quickly make end yea wee shall left behinde since thou art well disposed replyed donquixote withdraw self may heaven assist recompence thee sancho returned task earnest passion bark many tree fell great rigor fury wherewith hee scourged giving exceeding outragious lash upon hedge hee cryed alowd place samson shall dye donquixote ran presently
